First, we need to know who Ada Lovelace is. Ada Lovelace was an English mathematician and writer who is chiefly known for her work on Charles Babbage's early mechanical general-purpose computer, the Analytical Engine. 

Next, we need to know the era in which she lived. Ada Lovelace was born on December 10, 1815, in London, England, and died on November 27, 1852, at the age of 36. She lived during the Victorian era in England, which lasted from 1837 to 1901.

Now, we need to determine if dying at the age of 36 was considered tragically young for her era. Life expectancy in the Victorian era was around 40-50 years, so dying at the age of 36 was not uncommon or considered tragically young for the era. Therefore, the answer is (B) no, Ada Lovelace did not die tragically young for her era.

Finally, we need to determine whether she died at an unusually young age for her era. Ada Lovelace died at the age of 36, which was considered young even in her time. However, it was not necessarily tragic or unusual for her era. Many people died relatively young due to diseases and other factors that are now more treatable or preventable.

Therefore, the correct answer is (B) no, Ada Lovelace did not die tragically young for her era, as her age at death was not particularly unusual for the time period in which she lived.
